title: Analyst Crosswalk - Internal to External Taxonomy
description: ⚠️ ANALYST-ONLY: Maps neutral internal codes to external taxonomy names. DO NOT SHIP without proper license.
legal_notice: This file contains trademarked terminology and is for internal analyst reference only. It MUST NOT be included in production builds, client deliverables, or public repositories without appropriate licensing agreements.

crosswalk.notes: Corresponds to ASAM Criteria Level 0.5 - Early Intervention
Maps to ASAM Criteria Levels 3.1, 3.3, or 3.5 depending on clinical intensity
Corresponds to ASAM Criteria Level 3.7 with withdrawal management
Corresponds to ASAM Criteria Level 4 - hospital-based care

crosswalk.external_display: Medically Managed Intensive Inpatient Services with Withdrawal Management
crosswalk.notes: ASAM Level 4 with intensive withdrawal management (medical detoxification)

crosswalk.external_display: Ambulatory Withdrawal Management without Extended On-Site Monitoring
crosswalk.notes: ASAM withdrawal management at outpatient level

crosswalk.external_display: Intensive Outpatient Services with Withdrawal Management
crosswalk.notes: ASAM Level 2.1 with added withdrawal management capabilities
ASAM Level 2.5 with withdrawal management services

dimension_mapping.description: Maps our neutral six-domain model to ASAM Criteria dimensions

domains.external_name: Emotional, Behavioral, or Cognitive Conditions and Complications

domains.internal_name: Relapse, Continued Use, or Continued Problem Potential
domains.external_name: Relapse, Continued Use, or Continued Problem Potential

usage_instructions.purpose: This crosswalk enables analysts to understand how our internal neutral taxonomy relates to external standards if/when organization licenses ASAM Criteria.
restrictions: DO NOT include in production builds
DO NOT include in client-facing documentation
DO NOT commit to public repositories
DO NOT distribute without legal approval
use_cases: Mapping exercises for future ASAM integration
Preparing for potential ASAM Criteria licensing

license_information.note: If organization decides to license ASAM Criteria or CONTINUUM API, this mapping will facilitate integration.
